checkpoint.name: NRC has system to provides diet to children based on their clinical condition/ Medical complication
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Management of SAM are based on 3 phases: Stabilization Phase, Transition Phase and rehabilitation phase

checkpoint.name: Catch up diet (F-100) is given to the child.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Catch up diet is started when child is clinically stable and can tolerate increased energy and protein intake .Quantity of catch up diet given is equal to Quantity of starter diet given in stabilization phase

checkpoint.name: Starter diet (F-75) is given to child just after admission.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Feeding should begin as soon as possible after admission with ‘Starter diet’ until the child is stabilized

checkpoint.name: Hospital has Special diet schedule for the critical ill patients suffering from Heart Disease, Hypertension, Diabetes, Pregnant Women, diarrhoea and renal patients
Check for the Quality of diet provided
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask patient/staff weather they are satisfied with the Quality of food
